embed.title: {{e.Info}} Payment Command
embed.description: With the `{{prefix}}pay` command, you can send Sapphires to other people.

fields.name: üë• Mentioning People
fields.value:
I look for people using 3 different types of mentions.
1. {{message.author}} Mention directly
2. `{{message.author.id}}` Provide the account ID
3. `{{message.author.username}}` or `{{message.author.displayName}}` Also find by account name or on the server
_If you misspell the person's name, I will try to find someone with a similar name._

fields.name: {{e.safira}} Setting the Amount
fields.value:
You can enter the amount in different ways.
The limit here is what you have in your account.
When using letter representations, you multiply the value by the letter's value.
1. `1000` 1,000 Sapphires (thousand)
2. `1k` 1,000 Sapphires (thousand)
3. `1kk` 1,000,000 Sapphires (million)
4. `1m` 1,000,000 Sapphires (million)
5. `1b` 1,000,000,000 Sapphires (billion)
Supported letters: `k - m - b - t`

fields.name: üìÖ Setting the Expiration Date
fields.value:
By default, the payment remains active for 24 hours. You can set a time from `1 minute` to `7 days`
1. `1h 30m` 1 hour and 30 minutes
2. `1d 1h 1h` 1 day and 2 hours
Supported letters: `s - m - h - d` (`second - minute - hour - day`)

fields.name: ‚úçÔ∏è Examples
fields.value:
`{{prefix}}pay {{message.author.id}} 1k`
`{{prefix}}pay 2k @{{message.author.displayName}} 2d`
The sequence of arguments doesn't matter. This system is designed to identify users, values, and time.

fields.name: üéâ Multiple Users
fields.value:
You can pay multiple people in a single command.
Of course, you need to have all the required Sapphires.
`{{prefix}}pay 1k user userId @user user user userId @user 2d`

field.value:
**All the above features** are provided by Discord.
The bot {{client.user.username}} has **no connection** to this.

field.name: {{e.Info}} Note
field.value:
1. Roles with {{e.ModShield}} have the Administrator permission
2. Roles with ü§ñ are bot roles.
3. Roles with üë§ are the remaining roles.
4. I calculated a total of **{{roles.length}} roles**.
5. The sequence of roles is the same as the server.
6. The member count is provided by Discord and does not follow the real number.
7. Click **View Roles** again to refresh.

refresh.success:
{{e.CheckV}} | Information updated successfully.
{{e.Info}} | The role list pages will be remade.
{{e.Info}} | Supplementary information may take a bit longer than usual again.

connect4.select_a_valid_member: {{e.Animated.SaphireReading}} | You must select a server member to be your opponent. It cannot be any bot or yourself.
connect4.ask_for_an_party: {{e.Loading}} | {{member}}, you are being challenged by {{user}} for a game of Connect4.
connect4.you_cannot_click_here: {{e.Deny}} | You are not participating in this game, okay?
connect4.awaiting_player: {{e.Loading}} | Waiting for <@{{playNow}}> {{emoji}} to make their move...

fields.name: üìù Move History
fields.value: No moves yet

connect4.keep_calm_is_not_your_turn: {{e.Animated.SaphirePanic}} | Wait just a little, it's not your turn yet.
connect4.error_data: {{e.Animated.SaphireCry}} | {{user}}, Discord didn't deliver all the necessary data. Can you click the button once again?

fields.name: üè≥Ô∏è Objective
fields.value: The objective of the Connect4 game is to place 4 stones in a row (either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally). The first player to achieve this goal wins the game.

fields.name: üï≥Ô∏è Game Board
fields.value: Connect4 is played on a square board of 6x6, 6x7, 7x7, or 8x8. Saphire follows the 7x7 pattern. Each player is assigned a color, Yellow and Red.

fields.name: {{e.QuestionMark}} How to Play
fields.value:
The game starts with an empty board.
Players take turns, starting from the player with the yellow stones.
 In each turn, the player drops a stone of their color along one of the columns of the board. The placed stone falls until it reaches the bottom of the board or stays on top of another stone, regardless of the color.
